intro: Leucanthemum parthenium, commonly known as the common oxeye daisy, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its white petals surrounding a yellow central disk, forming a daisy-like flower. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and prefers full sun to partial shade. It has hairy stems and leaves that are usually alternate and lance-shaped. Leucanthemum parthenium is often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
